column1: Table 2-3:  Recent Trends in U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Sinks by UNFCCC/IPCC Sector/Category (MMT CO2 Eq.)
Iron and Steel Production & Metallurgical Coke Production
Caprolactam, Glyoxal, and Glyoxylic Acid Production
SF6 and PFCs from Other Product Use
+ Does not exceed 0.05 MMT CO2 Eq.
a Includes CH4 and N2O emissions from fuel combustion.

b Emissions from biomass and biofuel consumption are not included specifically in summing Energy sector totals. Net carbon fluxes from changes in biogenic carbon reservoirs are accounted for in the estimates for LULUCF.
c Emissions from international bunker fuels are not included in totals.

e LULUCF emissions of CH4 and N2O are reported separately from gross emissions totals. LULUCF emissions include the CH4 and N2O emissions reported for peatlands remaining peatlands, forest fires, drained organic soils, grassland fires, and coastal wetlands remaining coastal wetlands; CH4 emissions from land converted to coastal wetlands, flooded land remaining flooded land, and land converted to flooded land; and N2O emissions from forest soils and settlement soils. Refer to Table 2?8 for a breakout of emissions and removals for LULUCF by gas and source category.

Notes: Total (gross) emissions are presented without LULUCF. Net emissions are presented with LULUCF. Totals may not sum due to independent rounding. Parentheses indicate negative values or sequestration.
